IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Preservation of historic landmarks, communities and landscapes in order to protect and revitalize the character of the Statess communities and add to their economic vitality.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Preservation of historic landmarks, communities and landscapes in order to protect and revitalize the character of the Statess communities and add to their economic vitality.
IRS990.Desc: Preservation Services - Coaching, grants, workshops and other services that help community leaders and old house owners save and revive historic landmarks and help manage change to achieve stewardship and community development goals. Over 2,500 received services.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Preservation policy - Outreach and education to encourage the development and implementation of community and economic development tools such as tax incentives easements and other public policies

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Independent contractor to lobby for state-level legislative and administrative policies for preservation through research, planning and strategic development.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: Financial derivatives and other financial products

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association has been notified by the Internal Revenue Service that it is exempt from federal income taxes under Section 501c3 of the Internal Revenue Code. The Association is further classified as an organization that is not a private foundation under Section 509a3 of the Code. The most significant tax positions of the Organization are its assertion that it is exempt from income taxes and its determination of whether any amounts are subject to unrelated business tax UBIT. The Organization follows the guidance of Accounting Standards Codification ASC 740, Accounting for Income Taxes, related to uncertain income taxes, which prescribes a threshold of more likely than not for recognition and recognition of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. All significant tax positions have been considered by management. It has been determined that it is more likely than not that all tax positions would be sustained upon examination by taxing authorities. Accordingly, no provision for income taxes has been recorded.

Contribution specificially restricted for easements are reported as donor restricted net assets until expended for the appropriate easement. Easements are not carried as assets as the benefits are intangible.
Endowment funds held for future preservation service, public policy, and new ventures.
Copy of Form 990 is provided to board members for their review prior to filing.
The Board of Directors conducts an annual discussion concerning conflicts of interest with a written response from members in accordance with by-laws and state law.
In determining Executive Director compensation, the board evaluates market rates and survey data compiled by the NH Center for Non-profits and the National Trust for Historic Preservation.
A copy of Form 990 is available upon request.
